Energy Turrets/Ammo

Long-range Energy Turrets:

Beam Lasers

Deal lower DPS

Short-range Energy Turrets:

Pulse Lasers

Deal higher DPS

Frequency Crystals

Multifrequency
-50% optimal | 0% cap need

Gamma
-37.5% optimal | -15% cap need

X-Ray
-25% optimal | -25% cap need

Ultraviolet
-12.5% optimal | -35% cap need

Standard
0% optimal | -45% cap need

Infrared
+20% optimal | -35% cap need

Microwave
+40% optimal | -25% cap need

Radio
+60% optimal | -15% cap need

All Energy Crystals:
Primary Damage:Electromagnetic (EM)
Secondary damage:Thermal
Aurora
Longer-range crystals
+80% optimal | -75% tracking

Gleam
Shorter-range crystals
-75% optimal | +25% tracking

Gleam is an extremely short-range crystal.
T2 crystals last around 1,000 cycles.
Scorch
Longer-range crystals
+40% optimal | -25% tracking | 0% cap need

Conflagration
Shorter-range crystals
-50% optimal | -30% tracking | +25% cap need

Use Conflagration for slower/larger targets.
T2 crystals last around 1,000 cycles.
Imperial Navy Multifrequency
Shorter range & increased damage output
-50% optimal

Imperial Navy Xray
Shorter-range crystals
-25% optimal | +25% cap need

Imperial Navy Microwave
Longer range & increased EM damage
40% optimal | -25% cap need

There are a few other faction crystal types.
Faction crystals last around 4,000 cycles.
  • Laser turrets are used primarily by Amarr ships.
  • Beam laser turrets are longer range, and pulse laser turrets are shorter range.
  • Laser turrets provide high damage against the weak natural resists of shields (all factions except most T2 Minmatar ships).
  • Laser turrets are weakest against strong natural resists of armor (All Amarr & Gallente ships).
  • Highest CPU requirement of all weapons.
  • Heat Sink modules increase lasers' damage and rate of fire.
  • Crystals: Long-range lose tracking/DPS. Short range gain tracking/DPS.
  • Low-slot heat sinks increase laser DPS.
Close

Hybrid Turrets/Ammo

Long-range Hybrid Turrets:

Railguns

Very long ranges and less DPS

Short-range Hybrid Turrets:

Blasters

Very short ranges and (very) high DPS

All Hybrid Ammo:
Primary Damage:Kinetic
Secondary damage:Thermal
Spike
Longer-range ammo
+80% optimal | -75% tracking

Javelin
Shorter-range ammo
-75% optimal | +25% tracking
Null
Longer-range ammo
+40% optimal | +40% falloff

Void
Shorter-range ammo
-25% optimal | -50% falloff

Void is rarely used.
Caldari Navy Antimatter
Caldari Navy Iridium
Caldari Navy Lead
Caldari Navy Thorium
Caldari Navy Tungsten

There are a few other faction ammo types.
  • Many Gallente and some Caldari ships use hybrid turrets.
  • Blaster turrets are longer range, and Railgun turrets are shorter range.
  • Gallente is more suited to blasters while Caldari to rails (there are exceptions such as Hecate and Rokh, for example).
  • Hybrid turrets provide high damage against weak natural resists of shields (all factions except most T2 Minmatar ships)
  • Hybrid turrets have to be regularly loaded with fresh ammunition.
  • Long-range hybrid ammo lose tracking/DPS. Short-range hybrid ammo gain tracking/DPS
  • Low-slot magnetic field stabilizers increase hybrid DPS.
Close

Small Missile Launchers:

Rocket

Light Missile

Heavy Missile

Heavy Missile

Cruise Missile

Torpedo


Missile Damage Types


Mjolnir

Electromagnetic (EM)

Inferno

Thermal

Scourge

Kinetic

Nova

Explosive

Many pilots use the faction versions.
Precision
smaller/faster targets (i.e. frigates)

Fury
larger/slower targets (i.e. cruisers)
Javelin
Faster, longer-range missiles

Rage
Larger, slower, more DPS
Electron
Electromagnetic (EM)

Scorch
Thermal

Concussion
Kinetic

Shrapnel
Explosive

Void
Cap neutralization

Focused Void
Powerful neutralizing bomb

Lockbreaker
EMC burst bomb
  • Missile range is determined by velocity and flight time (no falloff).
  • Missile damage is determined by velocity and sig radius of the target, and explosion radius, explosion velocity and damage reduction factor.
  • Missiles fire more slowly than turrets and have a travel time, but higher volley.
  • Launchers have a reload time. You can stop firing and reload at any time.
  • Faction ammo from least damage bonus to highest: Guristas, Caldari Navy, Dread Guristas.
  • Low-slot ballistic control systems increase missile DPS.
Close

Long-range Projectile Turrets:

Artillery

Long range, very poor tracking and less DPS

Short-range Projectile Turrets:

AutoCannons

Short ranges, good tracking and high DPS

Hybrid Ammo

+60% optimal | +5% tracking

Longer-range ammo
+80% optimal | -75% tracking

Quake

Shorter-range ammo
-75% optimal | +25% tracking
Barrage

Increased-falloff ammo
0% optimal | 1.4x falloff | -25% tracking

Hail

Big, stationary objects ammo only
-50% optimal | 0.75x falloff | -30% tracking

Barrage is popular with ships like the Vagabond which like to skirmish in falloff range.
Republic Fleet EMP
Republic Fleet Phased Plasma
Republic Fleet Nuclear
Republic Fleet Fusion

There are a few other faction ammo types.
  • Projectile weapons are used primarily by Minmatar ships.
  • Autocannons are short-range projectile turrets, and Artillery are long-range projectile turrets.
  • Projectile turrets have to be regularly loaded with fresh ammunition.
  • Autocannon turrets have short optimal ranges but very long falloff.
  • Artillery turrets tend to have the best alpha strike.
  • Tech II ammo produces only kinetic and explosive damage.
  • Low-slot gyrostabalizers increase projectile DPS.

Small Focused Beam Laser II

Dual Light Beam Laser II

Previous Next

Example Small Beam Lasers

Weapon Range: 8-11km

Weapon DPS: 153 Volley: 497
Using I.N. Multifrequency

Bonus to Small Energy Turret activation cost
Bonus to Small Energy Turret damage
Reduction to Propulsion Jamming systems activation cost

High utility slot can have a NOS used at 6k.

High capacitor regeneration frigate.

Optimum Tactic:

Orbit at 3.5km with scram/web using Multifrequency/Conflag.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Orbit at 7.5km and overheat scram using Scorch.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slingshot to get scram/web and stay under guns.

125mm Railgun II

150mm Railgun II

Previous Next

Example Small Railguns

Weapon Range: 3-5.7km

Weapon DPS: 58 Volley: 177
Using Faction Ammo

Bonus to Small Hybrid Turret falloff
Bonus to Small Hybrid Turret damage
Reduction to Propulsion Jamming activation cost

Great range with up to 50% bonus to falloff. Meant to brawl, but makes a good scram kiter.

Blasters have better range with falloff bonus even beating autocannons on a Rifter hull.

Ion blasters and electron blasters can be used to allow a NOS/Neut in top slot, but are weaker weapons than neutrons.

Optimum Tactic:

Orbit at near 0km with scram/web.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Go toe to toe, or orbit at 7.5km and overheat scram using Null.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slingshot to get scram/web and stay under guns.

Example Osmium Fit

Close

Condor

Caldari Tackle Frigate - T1

Shield Scram Kiter/Kiter

Max Missile Range: 42km

Moderate Tank

EHP: 2,000 - 5,500 | Max MWD: ~4,500 m/sec

Kinetic missile bonus
Light Missiles Likely
EM/Thermal Hole Possible
Light Missile Launcher II

Max Missile Range: ≤42km

Weapon DPS: 58 Volley: 497
Using Precision Light Missiles
Rocket Launcher II

Rocket Range: ≤8km

Weapon DPS: 83 Volley: 229
Using Faction Rockets

Bonus to Kinetic Light Missile and Rocket damage
Reduction to Propulsion Jamming system activation cost

Missiles have better range than rockets allowing Condor's to be great kiters well outside point range if needed.

Although there's a kinetic rocket and missile bonus, it's not enough to switch from using correct ammo type on targets.

Uses rockets for scram kiting and longer-range missiles for kiting.

Optimum Tactic:

Orbit at 20km with point.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Orbit at 20km with point. Stay out of scram/web range at all costs and watch for slingshotting.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Keep at optimum and watch for slingshotting away from point.

Example Small Blasters

Weapon Range: 1.25-3.25km

Weapon DPS: 188 Volley: 423
Using Faction Ammo

Bonus to Small Energy Turret activation cost
Bonus to all armor Resistances

This is the Amarr defensive version of the combat frigates.

All tank brawler. Some use active tank.

Pulse lasers also get Scorch which gives the ship an optimal of 11km with a falloff of 14km.

Optimum Tactic:

Orbit near 4km with scram/web using Multifrequency/Conflag.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Go toe to toe, or orbit at 7.5km and overheat scram using Scorch.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slingshot to get scram/web if possible and stay under guns.

Breacher

Minmatar Combat Frigate - T1

Dual Tank Scram Kiter

Rocket Max Range: 7,350km

Moderate Tank

EHP: 3,000 - 5,500 | Max MWD: ~3,500 m/sec

Shield Booster Likely
Rockets Likely
EM/Thermal Hole Possible
Rocket Launcher II

Rocket Range: ≤8km

Weapon DPS: 105 Volley: 200
Using Faction Rockets
Light Missile Launcher II

Max Missile Range: ≤42km

Weapon DPS: 66 Volley: 392
Using Precision Light Missiles

Bonus to Light Missile and Rocket rate of fire
Bonus to Shield Booster amount

This is the Minmatar defensive version of the combat frigates.

Good damage and fast but short range with rockets.

Could see a missile-fit Breacher, but it's rare.

Optimum Tactic:

Scram-kite at 9km with overheated warp scrambler and speed tank using low signature bonus to their benefit.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Orbit at 9km away from guns.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slow with scram, hold with web if possible, and orbit closely under guns.

Example Small Blasters

Weapon Range: 900m-2.4km

Weapon/Drone DPS: 146 Volley: 471
Using Faction Ammo

Bonus to Small Hybrid Turret tracking speed
Bonus to Drone hitpoints and tracking speed

This is the Gallente offensive version of the combat frigates.

The Tristan is so versatile, it can be fitted any number of ways. The kiting fit is one of the strongest in the game.

The Tristan is a brawling-type ship that can kite.

Optimum Tactic:

Orbit at 3.25km with scram/web using Javelin.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Orbit at up to 29km away from guns with Spike.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slingshot to get scram/web and stay under guns.

Close

Crucifier

Amarr EWAR Frigate

Armor Tank

Range Support: 100+km Optimal

Drones: 15Mbit @ 45m³

EHP: 2,000 - 4,000 | Max MWD: ~3,750 m/sec

Bonuses to Weapon Disruptors

Weapons Fit A: Tracking Disruptors & Drones
Disrupts turret tracking range and/or speed.

Weapons Fit B: Guidance Disruptors & Drones
Disrupts missile range and/or precision.

The ship can support light weaponry but gunnery dps is generally not a threat.

Typically they orbit at max range and keep tracking/precision disruptors and drones on the target while fleet kills them.

EWAR cannot affect your drones.
Get to your optimal (close in).
Kill their drones if needed.

80% reduction in Propulsion Jamming activation cost
Immune to bubbles

With shield resist bonuses, it can take quite a beating for a frigate.

The Raptor's main weakness is lack of a tracking bonus, but it can compensate with web.

With four mid slots it can pack dual prop, dual webs, EWAR such as tracking disruptors.

Optimum Tactic:

Orbit near 0km with scram/web.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Go toe to toe, or orbit at 7.5km and overheat scram using Null.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slingshot to get scram/web and stay under guns.

Bonus to Light Missile and Rocket damage
Bonus to all shield resistances

Able to fit Command Burst mods
Bonus to Micro Jump Field Generator spool time
Bonuses to Armored Command and Information Command bursts
50% reduction in Microwarpdrive signature radius
50% Reduction in reactivation delay for Defender Launcher

This command dessie can hold a full rack of missile/rocket launchers for volley DPS up to 1,000.

Get to your optimal (close in).

Weapon Type

Weapon Range: ≤00km

Weapon DPS: 000 Volley: 000

Bonus to Small Energy Turret damage
Bonus to Small Energy Turret damage (x2)
Bonus to Small Energy Turret activation cost
Bonus to reduction in module heat damage taken

Tactical Destroyer bonuses:

Defense Mode

33.3% bonus to all armor resistances
33.3% reduction in ship signature radius

Propulsion Mode

66.6% bonus to Afterburner and Microwarpdrive speed
33.3% bonus to ship inertia modifier

Sharpshooter Mode

66.6% bonus to Small Energy Turret optimal range
33.3% bonus to Small Energy Turret damage
100% bonus to sensor strength and targeting range
66.6% increased resistances against hostile Sensor Dampeners and Weapon Disruptors

Very high damage, speed and projection with the three modes.

Use Aurora when approaching outside point range. Use Standard or Multifrequency crystals in prop mode, Gamma in sharpshooter mode and against slower targets (cruisers), and use Gleam if you get tackled.

Do not use defensive mode as it's typically not worth it (use prop mode to mitigate damage).

Optimum Tactic:

Scram-kite at 9km with overheated warp scrambler and speed tank using low signature bonus to their benefit.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Orbit at 9km away from guns.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slow with scram, hold with web if possible, and orbit closely under guns.

Example Medium Beam Lasers

Weapon Range: ≤52km

Drone Range: ≤60km

Weapon/Drone DPS: 408 Volley: 1,112
Using I.N. Multifrequency

Bonus to Medium Energy Turret activation cost
Bonus to Medium Energy Turret rate of fire

With six low slots, the Omen is naturally tank fit. However you can shield tank it for more damage mods in the lows

The ship doesn't have stellar DPS, but it has good damage application.

The Omen has a wide range by switching crystals, and it excels at skirmishing (20-30km).

Optimum Tactic:

Kite at 20km with point using scorch.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Orbit at 12km away from guns using I.N. Multifrequency/Conflag.

Tactic Against Kiters:

With point, keep at 20km. With scrambler, slow with scram, hold with web if possible, and orbit closer with short-range crystals.

Example Hybrid Railguns

Weapon Range: 17.3-32km

Drone Range: ≤60km

Weapon/Drone DPS: 416 Volley: 1,689
Using Antimatter

Bonus to Medium Hybred Turret damage
Bonus to Drone hitpoints, damage and mining yield

The Vexor is a highly versatile ship with many fits ranging from brawler to kiting ship.

Drones provide most of the damage, but weapons are not to be underestimated. With 125m³ of bandwidth and a lerge cargo bay, a wide range of drones can be used.

Rather than guns, Vexors can fit four slots full of Neut/NOS mods.

Optimum Tactic:

Due to the sheer number of fits, tactics will be based on the role and the fitting of each Vexor. Here are two example tactics:

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Orbit just outside gun range and control drones to apply damage.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Attempt to catch and slow and apply damage with guns/drones/neut/NOS.

Example Osmium Fit

Close

Caracal

Caldari Cruiser - T1

Shield Kiter

Max Missile Range: 55km

Moderate/Heavy Tank

Drones: 10Mbit @ 10m³

EHP: 15,000 - 35,000 | Max MWD: ~1,900 m/sec

Missile range
Rapid Light Missiles
EM/Thermal Hole Possible
Rapid Light Missile Launcher II

Max Missile Range: 55km

Weapon/Drone DPS: 248 Volley: 844
Caldari Navy Light Missile
Heavy Missile Launcher I

Max Missile Range: 35km

Missile/Drone DPS: 262 Volley: 1,288
Precision Heavy Missile

Bonus to Rapid Light Missile, Heavy Missile and Heavy Assault Missile launcher rate of fire
Bonus to Light Missile, Heavy Missile and Heavy Assault Missile max velocity

Use rapid lights for smaller targets, HAM for a combo of smaller and larger targets, and HML for larger targets.

With recent changes in HAMs, it makes the Caracal very versatile. Typically you burn away to 30-30km and kite.

The basic goal of any Caracal is to keep from getting scrammed at all costs. However, if you have a scram/web and can dictate range and be deadly against blaster ships.

Optimum Tactic:

Kite at max point range of 20-30km. Avoid getting scrammed at all costs.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Same kiting strategy.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Same kiting strategy but may need to overheat MWD to keep range against faster ships.

Using Barrage

Previous Next

Medium Artillery Examples

Weapon Range: 42-63km

Artillery/Drone DPS: 119 Volley: 679
Using Tremor M

Bonus to Medium Projectile Turret rate of fire
Bonus to Medium Projectile Turret falloff

The Stabber has a very high base speed, but at the expense at almost everything else (it's a weak cruiser).

Brawling Stabbers are very common as kiting stabbers cannot compete with rapid light missile cruisers.

Neuts tend to be the better choice for additional high slots, but rapid light missiles are common.

Optimum Tactic:

Catch target with MWD and scram at close to 0, then orbit at 500m with autocannons and drones.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Go toe-to-toe or back out to max scram range with Tremor.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slow with scram, and orbit closely under guns.

Scram-kite at 9km with overheated warp scrambler and speed tank using low signature bonus to their benefit.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Orbit at 9km away from guns.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slow with scram, hold with web if possible, and orbit closely under guns.
